com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Interface InputRecord

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Record

    public interface InputRecord
extends Record
    Interface for manipulating an incoming record. If Java bean object is specified by Processor.getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link) for this link, user code can get the Java bean object as record. The following example shows how to get the bean object from the incoming record. 

        Record inputRecord = _inputLink.readRecord();
    MyInputBean inputObj = (MyInputBean) inputRecord.getObject();
    _runningTotal += inputObj.getCost();
    _name = inputObj.getName();

    In addition, user code can get the column data by specifying the column name or index. The followng example shows how to get the column data in the incoming record. 

        Record inputRecord = _inputLink.readRecord();
    String name = (String)inputRecord.getValue("name");

    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object getObject()
      Retrieves an object of type specified by Processor.getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link).
      Object getValue(int columnIndex)
      Retrieves the value(an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType()) of a column corresponding to a given position in this record.
      Object getValue(String columnName)
      Retrieves the value(an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType()) of a column corresponding to a given column name in this record.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        Object getObject()
                 throws IllegalAccessException,
                        InstantiationException,
                        InvocationTargetException
        Retrieves an object of type specified by Processor.getBeanForInput(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.Link).
        Returns:
        A Java bean object
        Throws:
        IllegalAccessException - If the caller does not have access to the property setter method.
        IllegalArgumentException - If Java bean property object in specified bean object is not an instance of the class corresponding to the column in given row.
        InstantiationException - If the instantiation of the Java bean object fails.
        InvocationTargetException - If the property setter method throws an exception.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if Java bean class is not specified to the link.

      • getValue

        Object getValue(String columnName)
        Retrieves the value(an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType()) of a column corresponding to a given column name in this record.
        Parameters:
        columnName - column name (case insensitive)
        Returns:
        The value of a column as an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType().
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if columnName is null, or a given name of column is not found on this link.

      • getValue

        Object getValue(int columnIndex)
        Retrieves the value(an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType()) of a column corresponding to a given position in this record.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The position of the column in job design.
        Returns:
        The value of a column as an object of type specified by ColumnMetadata.getType().
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the columnIndex is invalid.
